column4: Hi, a friend of mine asked me to setup linux on their laptop, but I don't know where to begin.
where to begin? Begin with downloading an ISO image and burning it.
Ubuntu's fine for that
Kubuntu gives ya more eyecandys
You can save a flashdrive as well, using Grub to boot the ISO :D
More
If you need something lightweight you should really use Openbox or Xfce or something
More than enough to run Ubuntu, do not worry
It's not Windows 7 you know
Then download the 32-bit Ubuntu version.
I do agree... Is it at least an i686-compatible processor? If so we're fine
Um, you do not need to worry there, it is
That would be correct. But 10.04 will expire sooner or later. I suggest you try Xubuntu
What do you mean expire? Can't you just keep applying security updates to it?
Not forever. Every Ubuntu release has an expiration date, after which it's repositories will go offline
LTS are supported longer, but still not forever
Untrue. You can use classic gnome if you "apt-get install gnome-fallback"
Or you can use gnome-shell
You're free to choose

ext4 has some new filesystem options (large fs support, extents, multiblock allocation etc), but most of the time ext3 and ext4 perform the same. ext3 has more compatibility though (older, better tested)... I use ext3 myself, can't complain heh
thanks.
I would also like to point out that not all bootloaders have ext4 support (old grub doesn't support ext4, and I think syslinux doesn't either)
If you install the traditional networkmanager it will work just like in the standard edition
Very well then, just ignore what that person said, might be their hardware.
